Reviews.Title: took it back.
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Reception was no where near my old Motorola Razr. Dropped calls and reception was broken and filled with static. Touch screen didn't always move my contacts as it was supposed to. That was very irritating at times. Battery life was good and sound quality was great when the connection was good. I can only compare this to the Razr and it didn't stack up. I took it back.

Reviews.Title: Super sensitive phon
Reviews.Author: Roxad
Reviews.Content: Make sure you put the lock on your phone otherwise you will dial everyone. Touch screen is sensitive. The phone is great otherwise

Reviews.Title: Run from Kyocera & there cheap electronics
Reviews.Author: everydayonlineshopper
Reviews.Content: My ex bought me this for Mothers day a couple years ago and  this phone is tiny,light weight plastic glued together the phone would randomly reboot it's self then sometimes wouldn't take a charge finally after having the phone for almost two weeks I went to answer my phone one day and in the middle of the ring the phone shut  off and never came back on I tried every thing to get it to work extended charging time hard reset still nothing called Kyocera they were just as worthless as the phone  itself no help from them what so ever so they lied about the warranty

Reviews.Title: I will never buy a Kyocera product again!
Reviews.Author: Tim Gray
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone brand new from my carrier's website for $80. I wanted the touchscreen, the Bluetooth, and the media player support.The GOOD:- size and weight of the phone are nice.- support for microSD cards.- bluetooth supportThe BAD:- The phone has a cheap, plastic feel to it.- The proprietary website browser does not save your homepage preference and only displays text and pictures. No multimedia support.- The phone's media player does not support the standard way of storing mp3 files on an sd card (artist\album\title format) but only works if you place ALL your mp3s in a certain directory.Less than one month after purchasing it new:- the touchscreen became intermittently non-responsive until it was not functional at all.- The charging port stopped working- Kyocera refused to honor the warranty because the charging port was damaged, though they would gladly repair the phone for $57.50. Needless to say, I now own an $80 paperweight.

Reviews.Title: don't buy
Reviews.Author: Tenesha L. Choyce
Reviews.Content: Just bought this phone and I got it very fast but the company page plus says it's not one of there phones even though it says page plus on the opening screen so I am sending the phone back not very happy and also went on the kyocera web site and they said the phone was discontinued after several attempts from page plus to fix it was not worth I just want a new phone I can use.Don't buy this phone from Liberty Mobile TX I returned the phone because page plus said it was a unknown phone and I got 31.99 back for a refund because they claim I didn't request a ESN change something that should have been explained when I brought the product so they charged me for to reset the phone and for a plastic piece that I'm pretty sure didn't cost 12 bucks but thats ok they will never get my business again.

Reviews.Title: My, My, My
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Please be advised that this review is directed at the manufacturer of the product and not the seller. On the good side, shipping was fast and everything was in tact. On the downside, this phone is so light you can tell that it is cheaply made, but hey you get what you pay for.  It had a touchscreen, but I have flip phones that had better capabilities. Hence, I will be sending this back and stick with trusted brands like LG, Samsung, and even Motorola. No more off brands for me!
